column4: Hullo. Does anyone know of any guides or the like for doing a Ubuntu 'server' install ("server" at the CD's boot: prompt) and then adding in X, Gnome, etc.?
after the install is done you would need to add the extra stuff  like sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop
I don't want to install everything that comes standard with the non-server install.
installing it like that is easiest and sure way for X to work
thats not one package thats a bunch of them in one command
That's true, but I never said one package. I said one _line_.
ubuntu-desktop?
I didn't install that. I did a 'server' install and installed Gnome and X myself.
what is it saying it depends on
apt-get install whatever will tell you what depends on it and more than likely install them after asking you
